quote: One should take good care not to grow too wise for so great a pleasure of life as laughter.
To a man of pleasure every moment appears to be lost, which partakes not of the vivacity of amusement.
Work is often the father of pleasure.
A fool bolts pleasure, then complains of moral indigestion.
A great pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.
A life of pleasure makes even the strongest mind frivolous at last.
A mixture of a lie doth ever add pleasure.
A woman is an occasional pleasure but a cigar is always a smoke.
One should take good care not to grow too wise for so great a pleasure of life as laughter.
To a man of pleasure every moment appears to be lost, which partakes not of the vivacity of amusement.
Work is often the father of pleasure.
A fool bolts pleasure, then complains of moral indigestion.
A great pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.
A life of pleasure makes even the strongest mind frivolous at last.
A mixture of a lie doth ever add pleasure.
A woman is an occasional pleasure but a cigar is always a smoke.
Abstainer. A weak man who yields to the temptation of denying himself a pleasure.
All this fuss about sleeping together. For physical pleasure I'd sooner go to my dentist any day.
As soon as beauty is sought not from religion and love, but for pleasure, it degrades the seeker.
Beware of over-great pleasure in being popular or even beloved.
Buying is a profound pleasure.
Do not bite at the bait of pleasure, till you know there is no hook beneath it.
Do you know the only thing that gives me pleasure? It's to see my dividends coming in.
Don't mistake pleasure for happiness. They are a different breed of dogs.
Don't mistake pleasure for happiness. They're a different breed of dog.
Drinking is the soldier's pleasure.
Envy and fear are the only passions to which no pleasure is attached.
Everyone is dragged on by their favorite pleasure.
Fortune can, for her pleasure, fools advance,
Give them pleasure - the same pleasure they have when they wake up from a nightmare.
God almighty first planted a garden: and, indeed, it is the purest of human pleasure.
Great eagerness in the pursuit of wealth, pleasure, or honor, cannot exist without sin.
Grief still treads upon the heels of pleasure.
Grief walks upon the heels of pleasure; married in haste, we repent at leisure.
Had we not faults of our own, we should take less pleasure in complaining of others.
Happiness is neither virtue nor pleasure nor this thing nor that but simply growth, We are happy when we are growing.
Happiness is not pleasure, it is victory.
Happiness is unrepentant pleasure.
He is incapable of truly good action who finds not a pleasure in contemplating the good actions of others.
I advise you to go on living solely to enrage those who are paying your annuities. It is the only pleasure I have left.
I can think of nothing less pleasurable than a life devoted to pleasure.
I find my greatest pleasure, and so my reward, in the work that precedes what the world calls success.
I find the pain of a little censure, even when it is unfounded, is more acute than the pleasure of much praise.
I have a great mind to believe in Christianity for the mere pleasure of fancying I may be damned.
I never wanted to see anybody die, but there are a few obituary notices I have read with pleasure.
I wish thee as much pleasure in the reading, as I had in the writing.
I'm tired of love; I'm still more tired of rhyme; but money gives me pleasure all the time.
If pleasure was not followed by pain, who would forbear it?
If pleasure was not followed by pain, who would forbear it?
If we had no faults of our own, we should not take so much pleasure in noticing those in others.
In diving to the bottom of pleasure we bring up more gravel than pearls.
In love, as in gluttony, pleasure is a matter of the utmost precision.
Intellectual ''work'' is misnamed; it is a pleasure, a dissipation, and is its own highest reward.
Irresponsibility is part of the pleasure of all art; it is the part the schools cannot recognize.
It gives me great pleasure indeed to see the stubbornness of an incorrigible nonconformist warmly acclaimed.
It is a clear gain to sacrifice pleasure in order to avoid pain.
It is in his pleasure that a man really lives; it is from his leisure that he constructs the true fabric of self.
It is less difficult to bear misfortunes than to remain uncorrupted by pleasure.
It is one of man's curious idiosyncrasies to create difficulties for the pleasure of resolving them.
It is the only sensual pleasure without vice.
It is twice the pleasure to deceive the deceiver.
Love ceases to be a pleasure, when it ceases to be a secret.
Many a man thinks he is buying pleasure, when he is really selling himself to it.
Marriage is the miracle that transforms a kiss from a pleasure into a duty.
Most men pursue pleasure with such breathless haste that they hurry past it.
No entertainment is so cheap as reading, nor is any pleasure so lasting.
No verse can give pleasure for long, nor last, that is written by drinkers of water.
Now hatred is by far the longest pleasure; Men love in haste, but they detest at leisure.
On an occasion of this kind it becomes more than a moral duty to speak one's mind. It becomes a pleasure.
Once thoroughly our own knowledge ceases to give us pleasure.
One does not get better but different and older and that is always a pleasure.
One half of the world cannot understand the pleasure of the other.
Our pleasures are short, and can only charm at intervals; love is a method of protraction our greatest pleasure.
Pain adds rest unto pleasure, and teaches the luxury of health.
Pain and pleasure, grief and joy, passions and sensations succeed each other, and never all exist at the same time.
Pain and pleasure, like light and darkness, succeed each other.
Pain has its reasons, pleasure is totally indifferent.
Pain is less subject than pleasure to careless expression.
People have many different kinds of pleasure. The real one is that for which they will forsake the others.
People seem to enjoy things more when they know a lot of other people have been left out of the pleasure.
Perfect understanding will sometimes almost extinguish pleasure.
Pleasure and action make the hours seem short.
Pleasure and pain, though directly opposite are contrived to be constant companions.
Pleasure can be supported by an illusion; but happiness rests upon truth.
Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
Pleasure is labour too, and tires as much.
Pleasure is Nature's test, her sign of approval. When man is happy, he is in harmony with himself and his environment.
Pleasure is none, if not diversified.
Pleasure is nothing else but the intermission of pain.
Pleasure is sweeter as recreation than as a business.
Pleasure is the greatest incentive to evil.
Pleasure is the object, duty and the goal of all rational creatures.
Pleasure is very seldom found where it is sought. Our brightest blazes are commonly kindled by unexpected sparks.
Pleasure may come from illusion, but happiness can come only of reality.
Pleasure only starts once the worm has got into the fruit, to become delightful happiness must be tainted with poison.
Pleasure that is obtained by unreasonable and unsuitable cost, must always end in pain.
Pleasure that isn't paid for is as insipid as everything else that's free.
Pleasure usually takes the form of me and now; joy is us and always.
Poetry is the art of uniting pleasure with truth.
Pride is pleasure arising from a man's thinking too highly of himself.
Revenge is always the weak pleasure of a little and narrow mind.
Separate from the pleasure of your company, I don't much care if I never see another mountain in my life.
Sex: the pleasure is momentary, the position ridiculous, and the expense damnable.
Some persons make promises for the pleasure of breaking them.
Sometimes I read a book with pleasure, and detest the author.
Speed provides the one genuinely modern pleasure.
Speed, it seems to me, provides the one genuinely modern pleasure.
Surprises are foolish things. The pleasure is not enhanced and the inconvenience is often considerable.
Take from the philosopher the pleasure of being heard and his desire for knowledge ceases.
Taste is nothing but an enlarged capacity for receiving pleasure from works of imagination.
Tears are the natural penalties of pleasure. It is a law that we should pay for all that we enjoy.
Tell me what gives a man or woman their greatest pleasure and I'll tell you their philosophy of life.
The aim of the wise is not to secure pleasure, but to avoid pain.
The ambitious are forever followed by adulation for they receive the most pleasure from flattery.
The clog of all pleasure, the luggage of life, is the best can be said for a very good wife.
The eruption of lived pleasure is such that in losing myself I find myself; forgetting that I exist, I realize myself.
The essence of all art is to have pleasure in giving pleasure
The first draught serveth for health, the second for pleasure, the third for shame, and the fourth for madness.
The God of this world is riches, pleasure and pride.
The greatest pleasure I know is to do a good action by stealth, and to have it found out by accident.
The greatest pleasure I know, is to do a good action by stealth, and to have it found out by accident.
The greatest pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.
The mere brute pleasure of reading, the sort of pleasure a cow must have in grazing.
The natural flights of the human mind are not from pleasure to pleasure, but from hope to hope.
The noblest pleasure is the joy of understanding.
The person whose doors I enter with most pleasure, and quit with most regret, never did me the smallest favor.
The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid.
The pleasure of all reading is doubled when one lives whith another who shares the same books.
The pleasure of reading is doubled when one lives with another who shares the same books.
The pleasure that is in sorrow is sweeter than the pleasure of pleasure itself.
The pleasure that is in sorrow is sweeter than the pleasure of pleasure itself.
The pleasure we feel in criticizing robs us from being moved by very beautiful things.
The pleasure we feel in music springs from the obedience which is in it.
The puritan hated bear baiting, not because it gave pain to the bear, but because it gave pleasure to the spectators.
The rare pleasure of being seen for what one is, compensates for the misery of being it.
The rule of my life is to make business a pleasure, and pleasure my business.
The secret pleasure of a generous act, is the great mind's great bribe.
There is much pleasure ot be gained from useless knowledge.
There is much pleasure to be gained from useless knowledge.
There is no greater mistake than to suppose that a vicious life is a life of uninterrupted pleasure.
There is no pleasure in having nothing to do. The fun is in having lots to do and not doing it.
There is no pleasure in having nothing to do; the fun is having lots to do and not doing it.
There is no sterner moralist than pleasure.
There is no such thing as pure pleasure; some anxiety always goes with it.
There is pleasure in calm remembrance of a past sorrow.
Think only of the past as its remembrance gives you pleasure.
Though sages may pour out their wisdom's treasure, there is no sterner moralist than pleasure.
Thought is the labor of the intellect, reverie is its pleasure.
To me, being an intellectual doesn't mean knowing about intellectual issues; it means taking pleasure in them.
To me, the greatest pleasure of writing is not what it's about, but the music the words make.
Tomorrow is a thief of pleasure.
Tragedy delights by affording a shadow of the pleasure which exists in pain.
Variety in mere nothings gives more pleasure than uniformity of something s.
Variety is the soul of pleasure.
Variety of mere nothings gives more pleasure than uniformity of something.
Virtue is its own reward. There's a pleasure in doing good which sufficiently pays itself.
What is exhilarating in bad taste is the aristocratic pleasure of giving offense.
What is written without effort is in general read without pleasure.
When a man says he had pleasure with a woman he does not mean conversation.
When a man says he had pleasure with a woman he does not mean conversation.
When pain is over, the remembrance of it often becomes a pleasure.
When work is a pleasure, life is joy.! When work is a duty, life is slavery.
Why not seize the pleasure at once, how often is happiness destroyed by preparation, foolish preparations.
Why not seize the pleasure at once? How often is happiness destroyed by preparation, foolish preparation.
Women have simple tastes. They get pleasure out of the conversation of children in arms and men in love.
Work is not man's punishment! It is his reward and his strength, his glory and his pleasure.
Work is the meat of life, pleasure the dessert.
